author: Ellen M. Banner
title: Sea-Tac getting new, recycled runway
text:
Sea-Tac getting new, recycled runway   20, 2015 at 8:32 pm Updated July 20, 2015 at 8:44 pm Construction workers walk on a section of the new center runway at Seattle-Tacoma International Airport. More than 300,000 square yards of concrete from the existing runway is being recycled to be used for the new runway, taxiways and shoulders.Reconstruction is not expected to impact flight schedules, passenger traffic or any other airport operations. It is scheduled to be completed on Oct. 30. (Ellen M. Banner/The Seattle Times) As construction crews work near placer and paver equipment at the center runway at Seattle-Tacoma International Airport, one plane takes off as another waits to taxi during the reconstruction of the center runway. Concrete is spread by the placer (at right) and then smoothed out by the paver (at left). (Ellen M. Banner/The Seattle Times) An Alaska Airlines jet that just landed taxis over the center runway, which is under reconstruction, at Seattle-Tacoma International Airport Friday morning. (Ellen M. Banner/The Seattle Times) Ralph Wessels, airfield program leader with the Port of Seattle, points to the center runway at Seattle-Tacoma International Airport, which is under reconstruction. (Ellen M. Banner/The Seattle Times) As a plane takes off and another waits to taxi, dowel bars (purple bars) rest on dowel baskets at the new center runway at Seattle-Tacoma International Airport on Friday. Concrete 18 inches deep will be poured over the bars, re-creating the center runway at the airport. (Ellen M. Banner/The Seattle Times) More than 300,000 square yards of concrete (a small sample at right) from the existing center runway at Seattle-Tacoma International Airport is being recycled and crushed on site into gravel that will be used as the subbase for the new runway, taxiways and shoulders. After being crushed, it is placed on the conveyor belt at left so it can be piled up and then used. (Ellen M. Banner/The Seattle Times) 0 of 0 The center runway at Seattle-Tacoma International Airport is currently being reconstructed with more than 300,000 square yards of recycled concrete from the existing runway. Seattle Times staff photographer 
The center runway at Seattle-Tacoma International Airport is under reconstruction. 
More than 300,000 square yards of concrete from the existing runway is being recycled and crushed on site into gravel that will be used as the subbase for the new runway, taxiways and shoulders. Most Read Stories
